page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: { { {RAILWAYS}The Glasgow/Carlisle railway carries 20 passenger and 14 goods trains through Holywood Station daily. There is a wheel operating level crossing gates (worked by 2 men and 1 woman on shifts) which will become automated with half barriers in 1987. It will be operated from a new relay room at the old station.{ {BUSES}The Western S.M.T.buses en route from Dumfries to Ayr/Glasgow/Edinburgh or Moniaive carry varying numbers of passengers.They are often nearly empty although the school runs are busy. {CARS}The vast majority of households run a car. This does not however apply to the older people of the community, particularly in Holywood scheme who are more dependant on the bus service.
